Title: Tuples operations
text: In today's video, we will see the methods of tuples that you can apply on tuples to manipulate them. We are going to see a lot of things in this video. Let's go to the computer screen and let's get started. Intro Now see, when we talked about the list, we talked about the list methods.

Title: Tuples operations
text: We said that we can manipulate the list like this. Can we manipulate tuples? Not in a direct way. If you want to change a tuple, if you want to add a value in the tuple or if you want to remove a value, then there is no direct method to do this.

Title: Tuples operations
text: You have to copy it and make a list. You will have to make changes in the list and change it again in the tuple. Because the point of tuples is that you should not be able to change it. If there are 5 items in it, then there will be only 5. The sixth item cannot be added.

Title: Tuples operations
text: But now we are going to see here that what are the methods of tuples. Because they tell you how many elements are in the tuple. They give you information about it. So tuples are immutable. As we saw, if you want to add, remove or change tuple items,

Title: Tuples operations
text: then first you must convert the list to a tuple. And after that, you can add, remove and change it here. And after that, you can convert that list back to a tuple. I have taken a very good example here, which I want you to see. One tuple is made here.

Title: Tuples operations
text: And finally, I converted it back to a tuple. So this way you can change the tuple indirectly but not directly. You guys keep this in mind. Now see here that we can convert the tuple to a list. Manipulate items and convert it back to a tuple.

text: However, we can directly concatenate two tuples without converting them to a list. Because we are making a new tuple. We are not changing an existing tuple. We are making a new tuple. So when we are concatenating two tuples, a new third tuple is being made.
